questions.question: A bicycle travels $60$ meters in $10$ seconds. What is its speed?
A net force of $20\text{ N}$ is applied to a $5\text{ kg}$ mass. What is the acceleration?
questions.explanation: Newton's Second Law: $a = \frac{F}{m} = \frac{20\text{ N}}{5\text{ kg}} = 4\text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: If a person has a mass of $55\text{ kg}$ on Earth, what is their mass on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Mass is an intrinsic property and does not change with location. Only weight changes with gravity.

questions.question: A circuit has a $5\,\Omega$ resistor and a $10\,\Omega$ resistor in series. What is the total resistance?
How much work is done when a $10\text{ N}$ force moves a book $2$ meters?
questions.explanation: Work $= F \times d = 10\text{ N} \times 2\text{ m} = 20\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A $1\text{ kg}$ object is moving at $8\text{ m/s}$. What is its momentum?
A $50\text{ W}$ fan runs for $20$ seconds. How much energy does it use?
questions.explanation: Energy $= P \times t = 50\text{ W} \times 20\text{ s} = 1{,}000\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A car goes from $0$ to $20\text{ m/s}$ in $4$ seconds. What is its acceleration?
What is the weight of a $2\text{ kg}$ object on Earth? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
A $2\text{ kg}$ mass is moving at $4\text{ m/s}$. What is its kinetic energy?
A $12\text{ V}$ battery is connected to a $4\,\Omega$ resistor. What is the current?
An object has a mass of $200\text{ g}$ and a volume of $40\text{ cm}^3$. What is its density?
If you double the distance between two charges, the electric force becomes how many times smaller?
questions.explanation: Coulomb's Law: $F \propto \frac{1}{r^2}$. Doubling distance reduces force by $\frac{1}{2^2} = \frac{1}{4}$.

questions.question: A $5\text{ kg}$ box is lifted $3$ meters high. What is its potential energy? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
Two $20\,\Omega$ resistors are in parallel. What is the equivalent resistance?
A machine has $80\%$ efficiency. If it gets $100\text{ J}$ of energy, how much useful work does it do?
If $10\text{ C}$ of charge flows in $2$ seconds, what is the current?
How fast is a falling ball going after $2$ seconds? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$, ignore air resistance)
If voltage is doubled and resistance stays the same, what happens to the current?
questions.explanation: Ohm's Law: $I = \frac{V}{R}$. If $V$ doubles and $R$ is constant, $I$ doubles.

questions.question: A motor does $300\text{ J}$ of work in $10$ seconds. What is its power?
A $10\text{ kg}$ object moves at $3\text{ m/s}$. What is its momentum?
A $120\text{ V}$ heater uses $10\text{ A}$ of current. What is its power?
An object moves at constant speed in a straight line. What is the net force?
questions.explanation: Constant velocity means zero acceleration. By Newton's Second Law, zero acceleration implies zero net force.

questions.question: If you push a wall with $100\text{ N}$, how much force does the wall push back with?
questions.explanation: Newton's Third Law: Action and reaction forces are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction.

questions.question: A $4\text{ kg}$ ball is moving at $5\text{ m/s}$. What is its kinetic energy?
What is the power of a $10\,\Omega$ resistor with $2\text{ A}$ of current?
How many centimeters are in $3$ meters?
A person walks $100$ meters in $40$ seconds. What is their speed?
What is the weight of a $10\text{ kg}$ bag? (use $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
A spring is stretched $0.1\text{ m}$ by a $5\text{ N}$ force. What is the spring constant?
questions.explanation: Hooke's Law: $F = kx \rightarrow k = \frac{F}{x} = \frac{5\text{ N}}{0.1\text{ m}} = 50\text{ N/m}$.

questions.question: A $600\text{ W}$ toaster runs on $120\text{ V}$. What is the current?
A $3\text{ kg}$ toy is pushed with $9\text{ N}$ of force. What is the acceleration?
questions.explanation: Newton's Second Law: $a = \frac{F}{m} = \frac{9\text{ N}}{3\text{ kg}} = 3\text{ m/s}^2$.

questions.question: How long does it take to travel $80$ meters at $20\text{ m/s}$?
A $1\text{ kg}$ ball falls. If air resistance is $2\text{ N}$, what is the net force? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Weight $= mg = 1 \times 10 = 10\text{ N}$ down. Net force $= 10\text{ N}\downarrow - 2\text{ N}\uparrow = 8\text{ N}$ downward.

questions.question: What is the resistance if $12\text{ V}$ produces a current of $2\text{ A}$?
A $1\text{ kg}$ book is on a $2$ meter high shelf. What is its GPE? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
If one charge is doubled and everything else stays the same, what happens to the electric force?
questions.explanation: Coulomb's Law: $F \propto q_1 q_2$. Doubling one charge doubles the force.

questions.question: A car starts from rest and reaches $10\text{ m/s}$ in $5$ seconds. How far did it go?
questions.explanation: For uniform acceleration from rest: $s = \frac{1}{2}(v_i + v_f)t = \frac{1}{2}(0 + 10)(5) = 25\text{ m}$.

questions.question: How much energy does a $60\text{ W}$ bulb use in $1$ minute?
questions.explanation: Time $= 1\text{ min} = 60\text{ s}$. Energy $= P \times t = 60\text{ W} \times 60\text{ s} = 3{,}600\text{ J}$.

questions.question: Two $30\,\Omega$ resistors are in parallel. What is the total resistance?
A block has a mass of $500\text{ kg}$ and a volume of $2\text{ m}^3$. What is its density?
A person pushes a box $5$ meters with a force of $40\text{ N}$. What is the work done?
questions.explanation: Work $= F \times d = 40\text{ N} \times 5\text{ m} = 200\text{ J}$.

questions.question: A machine is $50\%$ efficient. If it uses $400\text{ J}$, how much useful work is done?
A $0.5\text{ kg}$ ball hits a wall at $10\text{ m/s}$ and stops. What was its momentum before it hit?
What is the current for a $24\text{ W}$ lamp on a $12\text{ V}$ battery?
A $50\text{ kg}$ student climbs $2$ meters in $4$ seconds. What is their power? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Work $= mgh = 50 \times 10 \times 2 = 1{,}000\text{ J}$. Power $= \frac{W}{t} = \frac{1{,}000\text{ J}}{4\text{ s}} = 250\text{ W}$.

questions.question: If you double the resistance in a circuit, what happens to the current?
questions.explanation: Ohm's Law: $I = \frac{V}{R}$. If $R$ doubles and $V$ is constant, $I$ becomes $1/2$ of original.

questions.question: A ball is thrown up at $10\text{ m/s}$. How long until it stops at the top? (use $g = 10\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: At peak, $v = 0$. Using $v = u + at$: $0 = 10 + (-10)t \rightarrow t = 1\text{ s}$.

questions.question: A $5\text{ kg}$ cart moves at $2\text{ m/s}$. What is its momentum?
How many meters are in $4$ kilometers?
